title: Calories in a Gyro
meta_description: Discover calories in a gyro, including full nutrition breakdown like protein, carbs, fat, and tips for variations to fit your diet.
assumptions: Standard beef/lamb gyro sandwich in pita bread with tzatziki, tomatoes, onions, no extra sauces; ~250 g total weight.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by meat type, portion size, restaurant recipe, and toppings. Check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A typical gyro has about 600 kcal, with 35 g protein and 45 g carbs from the pita.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a gyro sandwich?
faqs.a: Around 600 kcal for a standard beef/lamb gyro in pita with veggies.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a gyro?
faqs.a: Typically 35 g from the meat and tzatziki.
Yes, about 1200 mg per gyro due to seasonings and pita.
Lower at ~400-500 kcal if using falafel or veggies instead of meat.

faqs.q: How does gyro preparation affect calories?
faqs.a: Grilled meat is lower fat than fried; skipping pita reduces carbs significantly.
